clearfix"><div class="col-xs-9"><h1>Overview</h1><div class="excerpt"><div class="markdown-body" data-testid="RDMD"><p>An introduction to the Pinecone vector database.</p></div></div></div><div class="col-xs-3"><a class="suggestEdits" href="/edit/overview"><i class="icon icon-register"></i>Suggest Edits</a></div></div></header><div class="grid-container-fluid" id="content-container"><section class="content-body grid-75"><div class="markdown-body ng-non-bindable" style="margin-left:31px"><p>Pinecone makes it easy to build high-performance <strong>vector search</strong> applications. It’s a managed, cloud-native vector database with a <strong>simple API</strong> and no infrastructure hassles.</p>
<p>Pinecone has the following attributes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fast: Get ultra-low query latency at any scale, even with billions of items.</li>
<li>Fresh: Get live index updates when you add, edit, or delete data.</li>
<li>Filtered: Combine vector search with metadata filters for more relevant, faster results.</li>
<li>Fully managed: Get started, use, and scale with ease, while we keep things running smoothly and securely.</li>
</ul>
<p><a target="_self" href="quickstart">Get started using Pinecone.</a></p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="use-cases"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-use-cases" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Use cases</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Use cases" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#use-cases"></a></h2>
<p>Pinecone is useful for a broad variety of applications. The following are some of the most common:</p>
<ul>
<li><a target="_self" href="semantic-text-search">Semantic text search</a>: Convert text data into vector embeddings using an <a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/nlp/">NLP</a> transformer such as <a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/sentence-embeddings/">a sentence embedding model</a>, then index and search through those vectors using Pinecone.</li>
<li><a target="_self" href="gen-qa-openai">Generative question-answering</a>: Retrieve relevant contexts to queries from Pinecone and pass these to a generative model like OpenAI to generate an answer backed by real data sources.</li>
<li><a target="_self" href="ecommerce-search">Hybrid search</a>: Perform semantic and keyword search over your data in one query and combine the results for more relevant results.</li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/image-similarity-search">Image similarity search</a>: Transform image data into vector embeddings and build an index with Pinecone. Then convert query images into vectors and retrieve similar images.</li>
<li><a target="_self" href="product-recommendation-engine">Product recommendations</a>: Generate product recommendations for ecommerce based on vectors representing users.</li>
</ul>
<p>Want to see more and start with working example notebooks? See our <a target="_self" href="/docs/examples">example applications</a>.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="key-concepts"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-key-concepts" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Key concepts</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Key concepts" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#key-concepts"></a></h2>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="vector-search"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-vector-search" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Vector search</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Vector search" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#vector-search"></a></h4>
<p>Unlike traditional search methods that revolve around keywords, <a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-database/">vector databases</a> index and search through ML-generated representations of data, called <a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/">vector embeddings</a>, to find items most similar to the query.</p>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="vector-embeddings"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-vector-embeddings" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Vector embeddings</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Vector embeddings" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#vector-embeddings"></a></h4>
<p><a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/">Vector embeddings</a> are sets of numbers that represent objects. They are generated by <a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/sentence-embeddings/">embedding models</a> trained to capture the semantic similarity of objects in a given set. Pinecone supports two kinds of vector embeddings: <a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/">dense embeddings</a> and <a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/roughly-explained/sparse-vector/">sparse embeddings</a>.</p>
<p>You need to have vector embeddings to use Pinecone.</p>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="vector-database"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-vector-database" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Vector database</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Vector database" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#vector-database"></a></h4>
<p>A <a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-database/">vector database</a> indexes and stores vector embeddings for efficient management and fast retrieval. Unlike a standalone <a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-indexes/">vector index</a>, a vector database like Pinecone provides additional capabilities such as index management, data management, metadata storage and filtering, and horizontal scaling.</p>
<p><a target="_self" href="https://pinecone.io/learn">Learn more about vector databases</a>.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="workflow"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-workflow" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Workflow</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Workflow" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#workflow"></a></h2>
<p><span aria-label="workflow" class="img lightbox closed" role="button" tabindex="0"><span class="lightbox-inner"><img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pinecone-io/img/main/workflow.png" alt="workflow" align="" caption="" height="auto" title="" width="auto" loading="lazy"></span></span></p>
<p>Follow these guides to set up your index:</p>
<ol>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/manage-indexes">Create an index</a></li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/manage-data#connect">Connect to an index</a></li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/insert-data">Insert the data</a> and vectors into the index</li>
</ol>
<p>Once you have an index with data, follow these guides to start using your index:</p>
<ul>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/query-data">Query the data</a><ul>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/metadata-filtering">Filter the data</a></li>
</ul></li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/manage-data#fetching-an-item">Fetch data</a></li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/insert-data">Insert more data</a> or update existing vectors</li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/manage-indexes">Manage the index</a></li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/manage-data">Manage data</a></li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="pricing-and-deployment-options"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-pricing-and-deployment-options" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Pricing and deployment options</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Pricing and deployment options" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#pricing-and-deployment-options"></a></h2>
<p><a target="_self" href="https://www.pinecone.io/pricing/">Visit the pricing page</a> for pricing and deployment options.</p>

<p><a target="_self" href="/docs/quickstart">Go to the quickstart guide</a> to get a production-ready vector search service up and running in minutes.</p></div><div id="updated-at"><p class="DateLine "><i class="icon icon-watch"></i>Updated<!-- --> <!-- -->about 2 months ago<!-- --> </p></div><hr id="next-steps-divider"><nav aria-label="Pagination" class="Pagination1KE9HXCXYd0E rm-Pagination"></nav></section><section class="content-toc grid-25"><nav><ul class="toc-list"><li><a class="tocHeader" href="#"><i class="icon icon-text-align-left"></i>Table of Contents</a></li><li class="toc-children"><ul>

makes it easy to build high-performance **vector search** applications. It’s a managed, cloud-native vector database with a **simple API** and no infrastructure hassles.\n\nPinecone has the following attributes:\n\n* Fast: Get ultra-low query latency at any scale, even with billions of items.\n* Fresh: Get live index updates when you add, edit, or delete data.\n* Filtered: Combine vector search with metadata filters for more relevant, faster results.\n* Fully managed: Get started, use, and scale with ease, while we keep things running smoothly and securely.\n\n[Get started using Pinecone.](quickstart)\n\n## Use cases\n\nPinecone is useful for a broad variety of applications. The following are some of the most common:\n\n* [Semantic text search](semantic-text-search): Convert text data into vector embeddings using an [NLP](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/nlp/) transformer such as [a sentence embedding model](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/sentence-embeddings/), then index and search through those vectors using Pinecone.\n* [Generative question-answering](gen-qa-openai): Retrieve relevant contexts to queries from Pinecone and pass these to a generative model like OpenAI to generate an answer backed by real data sources.\n* [Hybrid search](ecommerce-search): Perform semantic and keyword search over your data in one query and combine the results for more relevant results.\n* [Image similarity search](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/image-similarity-search): Transform image data into vector embeddings and build an index with Pinecone. Then convert query images into vectors and retrieve similar images.\n* [Product recommendations](product-recommendation-engine): Generate product recommendations for ecommerce based on vectors representing users.\n\nWant to see more and start with working example notebooks? See our [example applications](/docs/examples).\n\n## Key concepts\n\n#### Vector search\n\nUnlike traditional search methods that revolve around keywords, [vector databases](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-database/) index and search through ML-generated representations of data, called [vector embeddings](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/), to find items most similar to the query.\n\n#### Vector embeddings\n\n[Vector embeddings](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/) are sets of numbers that represent objects. They are generated by [embedding models](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/sentence-embeddings/) trained to capture the semantic similarity of objects in a given set. Pinecone supports two kinds of vector embeddings: [dense embeddings](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/) and [sparse embeddings](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/roughly-explained/sparse-vector/).\n\nYou need to have vector embeddings to use Pinecone.\n\n#### Vector database\n\nA [vector database](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-database/) indexes and stores vector embeddings for efficient management and fast retrieval. Unlike a standalone [vector index](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-indexes/), a vector database like Pinecone provides additional capabilities such as index management, data management, metadata storage and filtering, and horizontal scaling.\n\n[Learn more about vector databases](https://pinecone.io/learn).\n\n## Workflow\n\n![workflow](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pinecone-io/img/main/workflow.png)\n\nFollow these guides to set up your index:\n\n1. [Create an index](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-indexes)\n2. [Connect to an index](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-data#connect)\n3. [Insert the data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/insert-data) and vectors into the index\n\nOnce you have an index with data, follow these guides to start using your index:\n\n- [Query the data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/query-data)\n  - [Filter the data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/metadata-filtering)\n- [Fetch data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-data#fetching-an-item)\n- [Insert more data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/insert-data) or update existing vectors\n- [Manage the index](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-indexes)\n- [Manage data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-data)\n\n## Pricing and deployment options\n\n[Visit the pricing page](https://www.pinecone.io/pricing/) for pricing and deployment options.\n\n## Get started\n\n[Go to the quickstart guide](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/quickstart) to get a production-ready vector search service up and running in The following are some of the most common:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"semantic-text-search\" target=\"\" title=\"\">Semantic text search</a>: Convert text data into vector embeddings using an <a href=\"https://www.pinecone.io/learn/nlp/\" target=\"\" title=\"\">NLP</a> transformer such as <a href=\"https://www.pinecone.io/learn/sentence-embeddings/\" target=\"\" title=\"\">a sentence embedding model</a>, then index and search through those vectors using Pinecone.</li>\n<li><a href=\"gen-qa-openai\" target=\"\" title=\"\">Generative question-answering</a>: Retrieve relevant contexts to queries from Pinecone and pass these to a generative model like OpenAI to generate an answer backed by real data sources.</li>\n<li><a href=\"ecommerce-search\" target=\"\" title=\"\">Hybrid search</a>: Perform semantic and keyword search over your data in one query and combine the results for more relevant results.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/image-similarity-search\" target=\"\" title=\"\">Image similarity search</a>: Transform image data into vector embeddings and build an index with Pinecone. See our <a href=\"/docs/examples\" target=\"\" title=\"\">example applications</a>.</p>\n<h2 class=\"heading heading-2 header-scroll\" align=\"\"><div class=\"heading-anchor anchor waypoint\" id=\"key-concepts\"></div><div class=\"heading-text\"><div id=\"section-key-concepts\" class=\"heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\"></div>Key concepts</div><a aria-label=\"Skip link to Key concepts\" class=\"heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\" href=\"#key-concepts\"></a></h2>\n<h4 class=\"heading heading-4 header-scroll\" align=\"\"><div class=\"heading-anchor anchor waypoint\" id=\"vector-search\"></div><div class=\"heading-text\"><div id=\"section-vector-search\" class=\"heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\"></div>Vector search</div><a aria-label=\"Skip link to Vector search\" class=\"heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\" href=\"#vector-search\"></a></h4>\n<p>Unlike traditional search methods that revolve around keywords, <a href=\"https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-database/\" target=\"\" title=\"\">vector databases</a> index and search through ML-generated representations of data, called <a href=\"https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/\" target=\"\" title=\"\">vector embeddings</a>, to find items most similar to the query.</p>\n<h4 class=\"heading heading-4 header-scroll\" align=\"\"><div class=\"heading-anchor anchor waypoint\" id=\"vector-embeddings\"></div><div class=\"heading-text\"><div id=\"section-vector-embeddings\" class=\"heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\"></div>Vector embeddings</div><a aria-label=\"Skip link to Vector embeddings\" class=\"heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\" href=\"#vector-embeddings\"></a></h4>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/\" target=\"\" title=\"\">Vector embeddings</a> are sets of numbers that represent objects. They are generated by <a href=\"https://www.pinecone.io/learn/sentence-embeddings/\" target=\"\" title=\"\">embedding models</a> trained to capture the semantic similarity of objects in a given set. Pinecone supports two kinds of vector embeddings: <a href=\"https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/\" target=\"\" title=\"\">dense embeddings</a> and <a href=\"https://www.pinecone.io/learn/roughly-explained/sparse-vector/\" target=\"\" title=\"\">sparse embeddings</a>.</p>\n<p>You need to have vector embeddings to use Pinecone.</p>\n<h4 class=\"heading heading-4 header-scroll\" align=\"\"><div class=\"heading-anchor anchor waypoint\" id=\"vector-database\"></div><div class=\"heading-text\"><div id=\"section-vector-database\" class=\"heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\"></div>Vector database</div><a aria-label=\"Skip link to Vector database\" class=\"heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\" href=\"#vector-database\"></a></h4>\n<p>A <a href=\"https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-database/\" target=\"\" title=\"\">vector database</a> indexes and stores vector embeddings for efficient management and fast retrieval. introduction to the Pinecone vector database.","body":"Pinecone makes it easy to build high-performance **vector search** applications. It’s a managed, cloud-native vector database with a **simple API** and no infrastructure hassles.\n\nPinecone has the following attributes:\n\n* Fast: Get ultra-low query latency at any scale, even with billions of items.\n* Fresh: Get live index updates when you add, edit, or delete data.\n* Filtered: Combine vector search with metadata filters for more relevant, faster results.\n* Fully managed: Get started, use, and scale with ease, while we keep things running smoothly and securely.\n\n[Get started using Pinecone.](quickstart)\n\n## Use cases\n\nPinecone is useful for a broad variety of applications. The following are some of the most common:\n\n* [Semantic text search](semantic-text-search): Convert text data into vector embeddings using an [NLP](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/nlp/) transformer such as [a sentence embedding model](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/sentence-embeddings/), then index and search through those vectors using Pinecone.\n* [Generative question-answering](gen-qa-openai): Retrieve relevant contexts to queries from Pinecone and pass these to a generative model like OpenAI to generate an answer backed by real data sources.\n* [Hybrid search](ecommerce-search): Perform semantic and keyword search over your data in one query and combine the results for more relevant results.\n* [Image similarity search](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/image-similarity-search): Transform image data into vector embeddings and build an index with Pinecone. Then convert query images into vectors and retrieve similar images.\n* [Product recommendations](product-recommendation-engine): Generate product recommendations for ecommerce based on vectors representing users.\n\nWant to see more and start with working example notebooks? See our [example applications](/docs/examples).\n\n## Key concepts\n\n#### Vector search\n\nUnlike traditional search methods that revolve around keywords, [vector databases](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-database/) index and search through ML-generated representations of data, called [vector embeddings](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/), to find items most similar to the query.\n\n#### Vector embeddings\n\n[Vector embeddings](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/) are sets of numbers that represent objects. They are generated by [embedding models](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/sentence-embeddings/) trained to capture the semantic similarity of objects in a given set. Pinecone supports two kinds of vector embeddings: [dense embeddings](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-embeddings/) and [sparse embeddings](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/roughly-explained/sparse-vector/).\n\nYou need to have vector embeddings to use Pinecone.\n\n#### Vector database\n\nA [vector database](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-database/) indexes and stores vector embeddings for efficient management and fast retrieval. Unlike a standalone [vector index](https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vector-indexes/), a vector database like Pinecone provides additional capabilities such as index management, data management, metadata storage and filtering, and horizontal scaling.\n\n[Learn more about vector databases](https://pinecone.io/learn).\n\n## Workflow\n\n![workflow](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pinecone-io/img/main/workflow.png)\n\nFollow these guides to set up your index:\n\n1. [Create an index](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-indexes)\n2. [Connect to an index](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-data#connect)\n3. [Insert the data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/insert-data) and vectors into the index\n\nOnce you have an index with data, follow these guides to start using your index:\n\n- [Query the data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/query-data)\n  - [Filter the data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/metadata-filtering)\n- [Fetch data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-data#fetching-an-item)\n- [Insert more data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/insert-data) or update existing vectors\n- [Manage the index](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-indexes)\n- [Manage data](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/manage-data)\n\n## Pricing and deployment options\n\n[Visit the pricing page](https://www.pinecone.io/pricing/) for pricing and deployment options.\n\n## Get started\n\n[Go to the quickstart guide](https://docs.pinecone.io/docs/quickstart) to get a production-ready vector search service up and running in // Create dropdown links
function createChildren(element, data) {
  // create new element to replace parent link
  const newElement = document.createElement("div");
  newElement.classList.add("dropdown-parent");
  element.classList.forEach((c) => newElement.classList.add(c));
  newElement.innerHTML = element.innerHTML;
  
  // create dropdown
  const dropdownContent = document.createElement("div");
  dropdownContent.classList.add("dropdown-content");
	if (data.length >= 5) {
    dropdownContent.style.marginTop='35px';
  }
  
  // Create dropdown links and append to dropdown
  data.forEach((l) => {
    const childLink = document.createElement("a");
    childLink.href = l.url;
    childLink.innerText = l.name;
    dropdownContent.append(childLink);
  });

  // Append dropdown to new element and insert caret svg
  newElement.append(dropdownContent);
  newElement.insertAdjacentHTML(
    "beforeend",
    `<svg enable-background="new 0 0 29 14" width="10" viewBox="0 0 29 14"><polygon fill="#000" points="0.15,0 14.5,14.35 28.85,0"></polygon></svg>`
  );
  
  // Replace old link with new element
  element.replaceWith(newElement);
}

// Work in progress
// API reference
$(window).on("pageLoad", function (e, state) {
  setTimeout(() => {
    const pagePath = window.location.pathname;

    if (pagePath.includes("/reference/")) {
      // Updates the custom examples in the API reference with user input (API key, environment, collection/index names)
      updateApiReferenceExamples(pagePath);

      // Replaces the copy button in the API reference to fix copying updated code
      replaceCopyButton()
    }

    if (pagePath.includes("/create_index")) {
      // Updates the custom examples in the create_index page with user input (extra body params)
      updateCreateIndexExamples();
    }
  }, 50);
});

async function copyApiReferenceExample(e) {
  // Copies the code in the API reference example codeblock
  // needed because the default copy button doesn't copy the updated code
  const codeMirrorCode = document.querySelector(
    ".rm-PlaygroundRequest > pre.CodeSnippet div.CodeMirror-code"
  );
  let copiedCode = "";
  
  Array.from(codeMirrorCode.children).forEach((child) => {
    const preElement = child.querySelector("pre.CodeMirror-line");
    if (preElement) {
      copiedCode += preElement.innerText + "\n";
    }
  });

  try {
    await navigator.clipboard.writeText(copiedCode)
  
    e.target.classList.remove("icon-clipboard");
    e.target.classList.add("icon-check1");
  
    setTimeout(() => {
      e.target.classList.remove("icon-check1");
      e.target.classList.add("icon-clipboard");
    }, 1000);
  } catch (error) {
    console.log(error)
  }
}

// Replaces the copy button in the API reference to fix copying updated code in custom examples
function replaceCopyButton() {
  const oldButton = document.querySelector("footer[class*='APIRequest-footer'] > button[aria-label='Copy to clipboard']");
  if (oldButton) {
    const newButton = oldButton.cloneNode(true);
    newButton.onclick = copyApiReferenceExample;
    oldButton.replaceWith(newButton);
  }
}

function updateApiReferenceExamples(pagePath) {
  // Basic API reference inputs - API Key, Environment, collection/index names
  const basicInputs = [
    // API KEY
    {
      inputSelector: "#APIAuth-Api-Key",
      stringToReplace: "YOUR_API_KEY",
      stringClass: ".cm-string",
    },

    // Environment
    {
      inputSelector: 'span[data-testid="variable-environment"]',
      stringToReplace: "east1-gcp",
      stringClass: ".cm-string",
    },

    // Collection / Index names
    {
      inputSelector: "#body-create_collection_name",
      stringToReplace: "example-collection",
      stringClass: ".cm-string",
    },
    {
      inputSelector: "#body-create_collection_source",
      stringToReplace: "example-index",
      stringClass: ".cm-string",
    },
    {
      inputSelector: "#body-create_index_name",
      stringToReplace: "example-index",
      stringClass: ".cm-string",
    },
    {
      inputSelector: 'input[id*="collection_collectionName"]',
      stringToReplace: "example-collection",
      stringClass: ".cm-string",
    },
    {
      inputSelector: 'input[id*="index_indexName"]',
      stringToReplace: "example-index",
      stringClass: ".cm-string",
    },
  ];

  // If create_index, also target the dimension input/variable
  if (pagePath.includes("/create_index")) {
    basicInputs.push({
      inputSelector: "#body-create_index_dimension",
      stringToReplace: "1024",
      stringClass: ".cm-number",
    })
  }

  const replacers = [];

  basicInputs.forEach((input) => {
    const inputElement = document.querySelector(input.inputSelector);
    if (inputElement) {
      const replacer = new Replacer(
        inputElement,
        input.inputSelector,
        input.stringToReplace,
        input.stringClass
      );

      replacer.replaceStrings();
      replacer.addListener();
      replacers.push(replacer);
    }
  });

  // Observe the language picker for changes
  const languagePicker = document.querySelector(".rm-LanguagePicker");
  if (languagePicker) {
    languagePicker.addEventListener("click", () => {
      replacers.forEach((replacer) => {
        replacer.removeListener();
      });

      setTimeout(() => {
        replacers.forEach((replacer) => {
          replacer.retargetElements();
          replacer.replaceStrings();
          replacer.addListener();
        });
      }, 50);
    });
  }

  // Observe the library picker for changes
  const library = document.querySelector(
    "span[class^='APIRequest-header-title']"
  );
  if (library) {
    const observer = new MutationObserver(function (event) {
      replacers.forEach((replacer) => {
        replacer.removeListener();
      });

      setTimeout(() => {
        replacers.forEach((replacer) => {
          replacer.retargetElements();
          replacer.replaceStrings();
          replacer.addListener();
        });
      }, 50);
    });

    observer.observe(library, {
      characterData: true,
      subtree: true,
    });
  }
}

class Replacer {
  constructor(input, inputSelector, stringToReplace, stringClass) {
    this.inputSelector = inputSelector;
    this.input = input;
    this.stringToReplace = stringToReplace;
    this.stringClass = stringClass;

    this.targetElements = Array.from(
      document.querySelectorAll(stringClass)
    ).filter((el) => el.innerText.includes(stringToReplace));

    this.val = inputSelector.startsWith("span") ? "innerText" : "value";
    this.event = inputSelector.startsWith("span")
      ? "DOMSubtreeModified"
      : "input";
  }

  retargetElements() {
    this.targetElements = Array.from(
      document.querySelectorAll(this.stringClass)
    ).filter((el) => el.innerText.includes(this.stringToReplace));
  }

  replaceStrings() {
    if (this.input[this.val].length > 0) {
      this.targetElements.forEach((el) => {
        el.innerText =
          this.stringClass === ".cm-number"
            ? `${this.input[this.val]}`
            : `'${this.input[this.val]}'`;
      });
    }
  }

  replaceStringsBound() {
    return this.replaceStrings.bind(this);
  }

  addListener() {
    this.boundReplaceStrings = this.replaceStringsBound();
    this.input.addEventListener(this.event, this.boundReplaceStrings);
  }

  removeListener() {
    this.input.removeEventListener(this.event, this.boundReplaceStrings);
  }
}

function updateCreateIndexExamples() {
  // Field state
  let fields = {
    dimension: "",
    metric: "",
    pods: "",
    replicas: "",
    pod_type: "",
    source_collection: "",
  };

  // Target the "dimensions" variables in the codeblock and insert an empty span element next to it, to put our custom code inside it
  createCustomSpans();

  // Target each form input and update the fields state with their values
  Object.keys(fields).forEach((key) => {
    const input = document.querySelector(`#body-create_index_${key}`);

    if (input) {
      fields[key] = input.value;

      // Add an event listener for further updates
      input.addEventListener("input", (e) => {
        fields[key] = e.target.value;
        updateCustomSpans();
      });
    }
  });

  // Update the custom span element with the field values
  updateCustomSpans();

  function updateCustomSpans() {
    const customCodeSpans = document.querySelectorAll(".cm-custom-code");
    customCodeSpans.forEach((i) => {
      i.innerHTML = `${
        fields.metric &&
        ', \n                      <span class="cm-variable">metric</span><span class="cm-operator">=</span><span class="cm-string">' +
          "'" +
          fields.metric +
          "'" +
          "</span>"
      }${
        fields.pods &&
        ', \n                      <span class="cm-variable">pods</span><span class="cm-operator">=</span><span class="cm-number">' +
          fields.pods +
          "</span>"
      }${
        fields.replicas &&
        ', \n                      <span class="cm-variable">replicas</span><span class="cm-operator">=</span><span class="cm-number">' +
          fields.replicas +
          "</span>"
      }${
        fields.pod_type &&
        ', \n                      <span class="cm-variable">pod_type</span><span class="cm-operator">=</span><span class="cm-string">' +
          "'" +
          fields.pod_type +
          "'" +
          "</span>"
      }${
        fields.source_collection &&
        ', \n                      <span class="cm-variable">source_collection</span><span class="cm-operator">=</span><span class="cm-string">' +
          "'" +
          fields.source_collection +
          "'" +
          "</span>"
      }`;
    });
  }

  function createCustomSpans() {
    if (!document.querySelector(".cm-custom-code")) {
      const dimensionVars = document.querySelectorAll(".cm-number");
      dimensionVars.forEach((i) => {
        i.insertAdjacentHTML(
          "afterend",
          `<span class="cm-custom-code"></span>`
        );
      });
    }
  }

  function updateOnChange() {
    const activeLanguage = document.querySelector(
      ".rm-LanguageButton_active"
    ).innerText;
    const activeExample = document.querySelector(
      "span[class^='APIRequest-header-title']"
    ).innerText;

    if (activeLanguage === "Python" && activeExample === "DEFAULT") {
      createCustomSpans();
      updateCustomSpans();
    }
  }

  // Observe the language picker for changes
  const languagePicker = document.querySelector(".rm-LanguagePicker");
  if (languagePicker) {
    languagePicker.addEventListener("click", () => {
      setTimeout(() => {
        updateOnChange();
      }, 50);
    });
  }

  // Observe the library picker for changes
  const library = document.querySelector(
    "span[class^='APIRequest-header-title']"
  );
  if (library) {
    const observer = new MutationObserver(function (event) {
      setTimeout(() => {
        updateOnChange();
      }, 50);
    });

    observer.observe(library, {
      characterData: true,
      subtree: true,
    });
  }
}
